intrinsics.name: Vector Any Out of Range
intrinsics.purpose:
Tests whether the value of any element of a vector is outside of a
      given range.
intrinsics.result:
r is 1 if the
      value of any element of a is greater
      than the value of the corresponding element of b or less than the negative of the value of the
      corresponding element of b. Otherwise,
      r is 0.

list.implementation:
vcmpbfp.  t,a,b
  mfocrf    u,2
  rlwinm    v,u,27,1
  cntlzw    w,v
  srwi      r,w,5

intrinsics.name: Vector Average
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector containing the elementwise average of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      average of the value of the corresponding elements of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Bit Permute
intrinsics.purpose:
Gathers up to 16 one-bit values from a quadword or from each
      doubleword element in the specified order, zeroing other bits.

intrinsics.name: Vector Ceiling
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector r that contains the
      result of applying the floating-point ceiling function to each
      element of a.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      smallest representable floating-point integral value greater than or
      equal to the value of the corresponding element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector AES Cipher Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs one round of the AES cipher operation on an intermediate state
      array a by using a given round key
      b.
intrinsics.result:
r contains the
      resulting intermediate state, after one round of the AES cipher
      operation on intermediate state array a,
      using the round key specified by b.

intrinsics.name: Vector AES Cipher Last Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs the final round of the AES cipher operation on an intermediate
      state array a using the specified
      round key b.
intrinsics.result:
r contains the
      resulting final state, after the final round of the AES cipher
      operation on intermediate state array a,
      using the round key specified by b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Bytes
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a bounds comparison of each set of corresponding elements
      of two vectors.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Equal
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of comparing each set of
      corresponding elements of two vectors for equality.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding elements of a and b
      are equal.  Otherwise, the value of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Greater or Equal
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of a greater-than-or-equal-to
      comparison between each set of corresponding elements of two
      vectors.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding element of a is greater than or equal to the corresponding
      element of b.  Otherwise, the value
      of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Greater Than
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of a greater-than
      comparison between each set of corresponding elements of two
      vectors.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding element of a is greater than the corresponding
      element of b.  Otherwise, the value
      of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Less Than or Equal
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of a less-than-or-equal
      comparison between each set of corresponding elements of two
      vectors.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding element of a is less than or equal to the corresponding
      element of b.  Otherwise, the value
      of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Less Than
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of a less-than
      comparison between each set of corresponding elements of two
      vectors.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding element of a is less than the corresponding
      element of b.  Otherwise, the value
      of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Not Equal
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of comparing each set of
      corresponding elements of two vectors for inequality.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding elements of a and b
      are not equal.  Otherwise, the value of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Compare Not Equal or Zero
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of comparing each set of
      corresponding elements of two vectors for inequality, or for
      an element with a zero value.
intrinsics.result:
For each element of r, the value
      of each bit is 1 if the corresponding elements of a and b
      are not equal, or if the a element or
      the b element is zero.  Otherwise,
      the value of each bit is 0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Count Leading Zeros
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the number of most-significant bits
      equal to zero of each corresponding element of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is
      set to the number of leading zeros of the corresponding element
      of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Count Leading Zero Least-Significant Bits by Byte
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns the number of leading byte elements (starting at the
      lowest-numbered element) of a vector that have a least-significant
      bit of zero.
intrinsics.result:
The value of r is set to the
      number of leading byte elements (starting at the lowest-numbered
      element) of a that have a
      least-significant bit of zero.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for
      big-endian targets, and right-to-left for little-endian
      targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Count Trailing Zeros
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the number of least-significant bits
      equal to zero of each corresponding element of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is
      set to the number of trailing zeros of the corresponding element
      of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Count Trailing Zero Least-Significant Bits by Byte
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns the number of trailing byte elements (starting at the
      highest-numbered element) of a vector that have a least-significant
      bit of zero.
intrinsics.result:
The value of r is set to the
      number of trailing byte elements (starting at the highest-numbered
      element) of a that have a
      least-significant bit of zero.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for
      big-endian targets, and right-to-left for little-endian
      targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Copy Sign
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector by copying the sign of the elements in one
      vector to the sign of the corresponding elements of another
      vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is set
      to the corresponding element of b
      with its sign replaced by the sign from the corresponding element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Floating-Point
intrinsics.purpose: Converts an integer vector into a floating-point vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      closest floating-point approximation of the value of the
      corresponding element of a divided
      by 2 to the power of b, which must
      be in the range 0–31.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Signed Integer
intrinsics.purpose: Converts a floating-point vector into a signed integer vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      saturated signed-integer value, truncated towards zero, obtained by
      multiplying the corresponding element of a multiplied by 2 to the power of b, which must be in the range 0–31.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Unsigned Integer
intrinsics.purpose: Converts a floating-point vector into an unsigned integer vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      saturated unsigned-integer value, truncated towards zero, obtained by
      multiplying the corresponding element of a multiplied by 2 to the power of b, which must be in the range 0–31.

intrinsics.name: Vector Divide
intrinsics.purpose:
Divides the elements in one vector by the corresponding elements
      in another vector and places the quotients in the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is
      obtained by dividing the corresponding element of a by the corresponding element of b.

list.implementation:
xxspltd t,a,1
   mfvsrd  u,t
   xxspltd v,b,1
   mfvsrd  w,v
   divd    x,u,w
   mfvsrd  u,a
   mtvsrd  y,x
   mfvsrd  w,b
   divd    x,u,w
   mtvsrd  z,x
   xxmrghd r,z,y

xxspltd t,a,1
   mfvsrd  u,t
   xxspltd v,b,1
   mfvsrd  w,v
   divd    x,u,w
   mfvsrd  u,a
   mtvsrd  y,x
   mfvsrd  w,b
   divd    x,u,w
   mtvsrd  z,x
   xxmrghd r,z,y

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Double Precision
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts a vector of long integers into a vector of double-precision
      numbers.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is
      obtained by converting the corresponding element of a to double precision floating-point.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Even Elements to Double Precision
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the even elements of a vector into a vector of double-precision
      numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0 and 1 of r are set to
      the converted values of elements 0 and 2 of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
Differences in element numbering require different implementations
      for big- and little-endian code generation.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert High Elements to Double Precision
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the high-order elements of a vector into a vector
      of double-precision numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0 and 1 of r are set to
      the converted values of elements 0 and 1 of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
Differences in element numbering require different implementations
      for big- and little-endian code generation.

list.implementation:
xxsldwi    t,a,a,1
   xxsldwi    u,t,a,3
   xvcvsxwdp  r,u

xxsldwi    t,a,a,1
   xxsldwi    u,t,a,3
   xvcvuxwdp  r,u

xxsldwi    t,a,a,1
   xxsldwi    u,t,a,3
   xvcvspdp   r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Low Elements to Double Precision
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the low-order elements of a vector into a vector
      of double-precision numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0 and 1 of r are set to
      the converted values of elements 2 and 3 of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
Differences in element numbering require different implementations
      for big- and little-endian code generation.

list.implementation:
xxsldwi    t,a,a,3
   xxsldwi    u,a,t,2
   xvcvsxwdp  r,u

xxsldwi    t,a,a,3
   xxsldwi    u,a,t,2
   xvcvuxwdp  r,u

xxsldwi    t,a,a,3
   xxsldwi    u,a,t,2
   xvcvspdp   r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Odd Elements to Double Precision
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the odd elements of a vector into a vector
      of double-precision numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0 and 1 of r are set to
      the converted values of elements 1 and 3 of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
Differences in element numbering require different implementations
      for big- and little-endian code generation.

intrinsics.name: Vector Equivalence
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a bitwise equivalence (exclusive NOR) of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of r is the bitwise XNOR
      of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Exponential Estimate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector r containing
      estimates of 2 raised to the power of the corresponding elements
      of a.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      estimated value of 2 raised to the power of the corresponding element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns the value of the bth
      element of vector a.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      element of a at position
      b modulo the number of elements of
      a.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
slwi     t,b,1
 vextuhlx u,t,a
 extsh    r,u

slwi     t,b,2
 vextuwlx u,t,a
 extsw    r,u

rldic   t,b,6,57
 mtvsrdd u,t,t
 vslo    v,a,u
 mfvsrd  r,v

rldic   t,b,6,57
 mtvsrdd u,t,t
 vslo    v,a,u
 mfvsrd  r,v

rldic   t,b,6,57
 mtvsrdd u,t,t
 vslo    v,a,u
 mfvsrd  r,v

sldi     t,b,5
 mtvsrdd  u,t,t
 vslo     v,a,u
 xscvspdp r,v

rldic   t,b,6,57
 mtvsrdd u,t,t
 vslo    r,a,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract Exponent
intrinsics.purpose: Extracts exponents from a vector of floating-point numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of r is extracted
      from the exponent field of the corresponding floating-point
      vector element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract Floats from High Elements of Vector Short Int
intrinsics.purpose:
Extracts four single-precision floating-point numbers from the high
      elements of a vector of eight 16-bit elements, interpreting each
      element as a 16-bit floating-point number in IEEE format.
intrinsics.result:
The first four elements of a are
      interpreted as 16-bit floating-point numbers in IEEE format, and
      extended to single-precision format, returning a vector with four
      single-precision IEEE numbers.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
lxv      t,0(pcv)
  vperm[r] u,a,a,t
  xvcvhpsp r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract Floats from Low Elements of Vector Short Int
intrinsics.purpose:
Extracts four single-precision floating-point numbers from the low
      elements of a vector of eight 16-bit elements, interpreting each
      element as a 16-bit floating-point number in IEEE format.
intrinsics.result:
The last four elements of a are
      interpreted as 16-bit floating-point numbers in IEEE format, and
      extended to single-precision format, returning a vector with four
      single-precision IEEE numbers.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
lxv      t,0(pcv)
  vperm[r] u,a,a,t
  xvcvhpsp r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract Significand
intrinsics.purpose:
Extracts a vector of significands (mantissas) from a vector of
      floating-point numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is extracted from the significand
      (mantissa) field of the corresponding floating-point element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Extract Four Bytes
intrinsics.purpose:
Extracts a word from vector a at
      constant byte position b.
intrinsics.result:
The first
      doubleword element of r contains
      the zero-extended extracted word from a.
      The second doubleword is set to 0. b
      specifies the least-significant byte number (0–12) of the word
      to be extracted.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Index of First Match
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a comparison of equality on each of the corresponding
      elements of a and b, and returns the first position of
      equality.
intrinsics.result:
Returns the
      element index of the position of the first character match in
      natural element order.  If no match, returns the number of
      characters as an element count in the vector argument.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
vcmpneb  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  r,u

vcmpneb  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  r,u

vcmpneh  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  v,u
  rldicl    r,v,63,33

vcmpneh  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  v,u
  rldicl    r,v,63,33

vcmpnew  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  v,u
  rldicl    r,v,62,34

vcmpnew  t,a,b
  xxlnor    u,t,t
  vclzlsbb  v,u
  rldicl    r,v,62,34

intrinsics.name: Vector Index of First Match or End of String
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a comparison of equality on each of the corresponding
      elements of a and b. Returns the first position of
      equality, or the zero string terminator.
intrinsics.result:
Returns the
      element index of the position, in natural element order, of
      either the first character match or an end-of-string (EOS)
      terminator. If no match or terminator, returns the number of
      characters as an element count in the vector argument.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneb   u,a,t
 vcmpneb   v,b,t
 vcmpnezb  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  r,y

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneb   u,a,t
 vcmpneb   v,b,t
 vcmpnezb  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  r,y

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneh   u,a,t
 vcmpneh   v,b,t
 vcmpnezh  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,63,33

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneh   u,a,t
 vcmpneh   v,b,t
 vcmpnezh  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,63,33

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpnew   u,a,t
 vcmpnew   v,b,t
 vcmpnezw  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,62,34

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpnew   u,a,t
 vcmpnew   v,b,t
 vcmpnezw  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlnand   y,x,w
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,62,34

intrinsics.name: Vector Index of First Mismatch
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a comparison of inequality on each of the corresponding
      elements of a and b, and returns the first position of
      inequality.
intrinsics.result:
Returns the
      element index of the position of the first character mismatch in
      natural element order. If no mismatch, returns the number of
      characters as an element count in the vector argument.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
vcmpneh   t,a,b
 vclzlsbb  u,t
 rldicl    r,u,63,33

vcmpneh   t,a,b
 vclzlsbb  u,t
 rldicl    r,u,63,33

vcmpnew   t,a,b
 vclzlsbb  u,t
 rldicl    r,u,62,34

vcmpnew   t,a,b
 vclzlsbb  u,t
 rldicl    r,u,62,34

intrinsics.name: Vector Index of First Mismatch or End of String
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a comparison of inequality on each of the corresponding
      elements of a and b. Returns the first position of
      inequality, or the zero string terminator.
intrinsics.result:
Returns the
      element index of the position, in natural element order, of
      either the first character mismatch or an end-of-string (EOS)
      terminator. If no mismatch or terminator, returns the number of
      characters as an element count in the vector argument.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneb   u,a,t
 vcmpneb   v,b,t
 vcmpnezb  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  r,y

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneb   u,a,t
 vcmpneb   v,b,t
 vcmpnezb  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  r,y

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneh   u,a,t
 vcmpneh   v,b,t
 vcmpnezh  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,63,33

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpneh   u,a,t
 vcmpneh   v,b,t
 vcmpnezh  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicl    r,z,63,33

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpnew   u,a,t
 vcmpnew   v,b,t
 vcmpnezw  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicr    r,z,62,34

xxspltib  t,0
 vcmpnew   u,a,t
 vcmpnew   v,b,t
 vcmpnezw  w,a,b
 xxland    x,u,v
 xxlorc    y,w,x
 vclzlsbb  z,y
 rldicr    r,z,62,34

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Integer to Floating-Point
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts a vector of integers to a vector of single-precision
      floating-point numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements of
      r are obtained by converting the
      respective elements of a to
      single-precision floating-point numbers.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Two Vectors to Floating-Point
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts two vectors of long long integers or double-precision
      floating-point numbers to a vector of single-precision numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Elements of
      r are obtained by converting the
      elements of a and
      b to single-precision numbers.
      Elements 0 and 1 of r are converted
      from elements 0 and 1 of a,
      respectively, and elements 2 and 3 of r
      are converted from elements 0 and 1 of b, respectively.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxpermdi  t,b,a,0
 xxpermdi  u,b,a,3
 xvcvsxdsp v,t
 xvcvsxdsp w,u
 vmrgew    r,v,w

xxpermdi  t,b,a,0
 xxpermdi  u,b,a,3
 xvcvsxdsp v,t
 xvcvsxdsp w,u
 vmrgew    r,v,w

xxpermdi  t,b,a,0
 xxpermdi  u,b,a,3
 xvcvsxdsp v,t
 xvcvsxdsp w,u
 vmrgew    r,v,w

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Floating-Point in Even Elements
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the elements of a source vector to single-precision
      floating-point and stores the results in the even elements of
      the target vector.
intrinsics.result:
The even-numbered
      elements of r are obtained by
      converting the elements of a to
      single-precision numbers, using the current floating-point rounding
      mode.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert to Floating-Point in Odd Elements
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts the elements of a source vector to single-precision
      floating-point and stores the results in the odd elements of the
      target vector.
intrinsics.result:
The odd-numbered
      elements of r are obtained by
      converting the elements of a to
      single-precision numbers, using the current floating-point rounding
      mode.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Floor
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the largest representable floating-point
      integral values less than or equal to the values of the corresponding
      elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the largest representable
      floating-point integral value less than or equal to the value of the
      corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Gather Bits by Byte
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a gather-bits operation on the input.
intrinsics.result:
Within each
      doubleword, let x(i) (0 ≤ i < 8) denote the byte elements, with
      x(0) the most-significant byte. For each pair of i and j (0 ≤ i
      < 8, 0 ≤ j < 8), the jth bit of the
      ith byte element of
      r is set to the value of the
      ith bit of the jth byte
      element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Insert
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a copy of vector b  with
      element c replaced by the value of
      a.
intrinsics.result:
r contains a copy of vector
      b with element c replaced by the value of a. This function uses modular arithmetic on
      c to determine the element number.
      For example, if c is out of range, the
      compiler uses c modulo the number of
      elements in the vector to determine the element position.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xscvdpspn   t,a
 xxextractuw u,t,0
 xxinsertw   r/b,u,c*4

intrinsics.name: Vector Insert Exponent
intrinsics.purpose: Inserts exponents into a vector of floating-point numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is generated by combining the exponent
      specified by the corresponding element of b with the sign and significand of the
      corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Insert Four Bytes
intrinsics.purpose: Inserts a word into a vector at a byte position.
intrinsics.result:
Let W be the first
      doubleword element of a, truncated to
      32 bits. The result vector r is formed
      by inserting W into b at the byte
      position (0–12) specified by c.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element and byte numbering within a register is left-to-right for
      big-endian targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Load Indexed
intrinsics.purpose:
Loads a 16-byte vector from the memory address specified by the
      displacement and the pointer, ignoring the four low-order bits
      of the calculated address.
intrinsics.result:
The value of
      r is obtained by adding a and b,
      masking off the four low-order bits of the result, and
      loading the 16-byte vector from the resultant memory address.

intrinsics.name: Vector Load Element Indexed
intrinsics.purpose:
Loads a single element into the position in the vector register
      corresponding to its address, leaving the remaining elements of
      the register undefined.
intrinsics.result:
The integer value a is added to the
      pointer value b.  The resulting
      address is rounded down to the nearest address that is a multiple of
      es, where es is 1 for
      char pointers, 2 for short pointers, and 4 for float or int pointers.
      The element at this address is loaded into an element of r, leaving all other elements of r undefined.  The position of the loaded
      element in r is determined by taking the
      address modulo 16.

intrinsics.name: Vector Load Indexed Least Recently Used
intrinsics.purpose:
Loads a 16-byte vector from the memory address specified by the
      displacement and the pointer, ignoring the four low-order bits
      of the calculated address, and marks the cache line loaded from
      as least recently used.
intrinsics.result:
The value of
      r is obtained by adding a and b,
      masking off the four low-order bits of the result, and
      loading the 16-byte vector from the resultant memory address.

intrinsics.name: Vector Base-2 Logarithm Estimate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing estimates of the base-2 logarithms of the
      corresponding elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains an estimated value of the
      base-2 logarithm of the corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-Add
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a fused
      multiply-add operation for each corresponding set of elements of the
      source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the product of the
      values of the corresponding elements of a and b, added
      to the value of the corresponding element of c.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-Add Saturated
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a saturated
      multiply-high-and-add operation for each corresponding set of elements
      of the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is produced as follows:
      The values of the corresponding elements of a and b are
      multiplied. The value of the 17 most-significant bits of this product
      is then added, using 16-bit-saturated addition, to the value of the
      corresponding element of c.

intrinsics.name: Vector Maximum
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the maximum value from each set of
      corresponding elements of the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each element of r is the
      maximum of the values of the corresponding elements of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Merge Even
intrinsics.purpose: Merges the even-numbered values from two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The even-numbered
      elements of a are stored into the
      even-numbered elements of r. The
      even-numbered elements of b are stored
      into the odd-numbered elements of r.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Merge High
intrinsics.purpose: Merges the first halves (in element order) of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The
      nth element of r,
      if n is an even number, is given the value of the
      (n/2)th element of a.  The (n+1)th element
      of r, if n is an
      even number, is given the value of the (n/2)th
      element of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Merge Low
intrinsics.purpose: Merges the last halves (in element order) of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
Let
      m be the number of elements in r.  The nth element of
      r, if n is an even
      number, is given the value of the m/2 +
      (n/2)th element of a.  The (n+1)th element
      of r, if n is an
      even number, is given the value of the m/2 +
      (n/2)th element of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Merge Odd
intrinsics.purpose: Merges the odd-numbered values from two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The odd-numbered
      elements of a are stored into the
      even-numbered elements of r. The
      odd-numbered elements of b are stored
      into the odd-numbered elements of r.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Move From Vector Status and Control Register
intrinsics.purpose:
Copies the contents of the Vector Status and Control Register
      (VSCR) into the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
The high-order 16
      bits of the VSCR are copied into the seventh element of r, using big-endian (left-to-right) order. The
      low-order 16 bits of the VSCR are copied into the eighth element of
      r, using big-endian order.  All other
      elements of r are set to zero.
intrinsics.endianness:
The contents of the VSCR are placed in the low-order 32 bits of the
      result vector, regardless of endianness.

intrinsics.name: Vector Minimum
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the minimum value from each set of
      corresponding elements of the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the minimum of the
      values of the corresponding elements of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-High Round and Add Saturated
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a saturated
      multiply-high-round-and-add operation for each corresponding set of
      elements of the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is produced as follows.
      The values of the corresponding elements of a and b are
      multiplied and rounded such that the 15 least-significant bits are 0.
      The value of the 17 most-significant bits of this rounded product is
      then added, using 16-bit-saturated addition, to the value of the
      corresponding element of c.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-Subtract
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a multiply-subtract
      operation using the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is produced by multiplying the
      corresponding element of a by the
      corresponding element of b and then
      subtracting the corresponding element of c.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-Sum
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a multiply-sum
      operation using the source vectors.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply-Sum Saturated
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a saturated
      multiply-sum operation using the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
Assume that the
      elements of each vector are numbered beginning with 0. The value of each
      element n of r
      is obtained as follows. For p =
      2n to 2n+1, multiply element
      p of a by element
      p of b. Add the
      sum of these products to element n of
      c. All additions are performed using
      32-bit saturated arithmetic.

intrinsics.name: Vector Move to Vector Status and Control Register
intrinsics.purpose:
Copies a value into the Vector Status and Control Register
      (VSCR).  The low-order 32 bits of a are copied into the VSCR.
intrinsics.result: None.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply
intrinsics.purpose: Compute the products of corresponding elements of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r receives the product of
      the corresponding elements of a and
      b.

list.implementation:
vmulesb  t,a,b
  vmulosb  u,a,b
  lxvw4x   v,0,pcv
  vperm    r,t,u,v

vmulesb  t,a,b
  vmulosb  u,a,b
  lxvw4x   v,0,pcv
  vperm    r,t,u,v

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply Even
intrinsics.purpose:
Multiplies the even-numbered elements of the source vectors to
      produce the target vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element
      n of r is the
      product of element 2n of a and element 2n of
      b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Multiply Odd
intrinsics.purpose:
Multiplies the odd-numbered elements of the source vectors to
      produce the target vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element
      n of r is the
      product of element 2n+1 of a and element 2n+1 of
      b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Negated Absolute Value
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the negated absolute values of the contents
      of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the negated absolute
      value of the corresponding element of a. For integer vectors, the arithmetic is
      modular.

list.implementation:
vspltisw t,0
  vsububm  u,t,a
  vminsb   r,u,a

vspltisw t,0
  vsubuhm  u,t,a
  vminsh   r,u,a

vspltisw t,0
  vsubuwm  u,t,a
  vminsw   r,u,a

vspltisw t,0
  vsubudm  u,t,a
  vminsd   r,u,a

intrinsics.name: Vector NAND
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a bitwise NAND of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
r is the bitwise
      NAND of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector AES Inverse Cipher Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs one round of the AES inverse cipher operation on an
      intermediate state array a by using a
      given round key b.
intrinsics.result:
r contains the
      resulting intermediate state, after one round of the AES inverse cipher
      operation on intermediate state array a,
      using the round key specified by b.

intrinsics.name: Vector AES Inverse Cipher Last Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs the final round of the AES inverse cipher operation on an
      intermediate state array a using the
      specified round key b.
intrinsics.result:
r contains the
      resulting final state, after the final round of the AES inverse cipher
      operation on intermediate state array a,
      using the round key specified by b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Nearby Integer
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the floating-point integral values nearest to
      the values of the corresponding elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each
      element of r contains the
      nearest representable floating-point integral value to the value
      of the corresponding element of a. When an input element value is exactly
      between two integer values, the input value with the larger
      absolute value is selected.  The current floating-point rounding
      mode is ignored.

intrinsics.name: Vector Negate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the negated values of the contents of the
      source vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the negated value of
      the corresponding element of a. For
      integer vectors, the arithmetic is modular.

intrinsics.name: Vector Negated Multiply-Add
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a negated
      multiply-add operation on the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the product of the
      corresponding elements of a and
      b, added to the corresponding elements
      of c, then multiplied by
      –1.0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Negated Multiply-Subtract
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a negated
      multiply-subtract operation on the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the value of the
      corresponding element of c subtracted
      from the product of the corresponding elements of a and b, and
      then multiplied by –1.0.

intrinsics.name: Vector NOR
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a bitwise NOR of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
r is the bitwise NOR
      of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector OR
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a bitwise OR of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
r is the bitwise OR
      of a and b.

intrinsics.name: Vector OR with Complement
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a bitwise OR of the first vector with the bitwise-complemented
      second vector.
intrinsics.result:
r is the bitwise OR
      of a and the bitwise complement of
      b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Pack
intrinsics.purpose:
Packs information from each element of two vectors into the result
      vector.
intrinsics.result:
Let v represent the concatenation of vectors
      a and b.  For integer types, the value of each element
      of r is taken from the low-order half
      of the corresponding element of v. For
      floating-point types, the value of each element of r is the corresponding element of v, rounded to the result type.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxpermdi  t,a,b,0
 xxpermdi  u,a,b,3
 xvcvdpsp  t,t
 xvcvdpsp  u,u
 vmrgew    r,t,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Pack 32-bit Float to Short
intrinsics.purpose:
Packs eight single-precision 32-bit floating-point numbers from two
      source vectors into a vector of eight 16-bit floating-point numbers.
intrinsics.result:
Let v represent the 16-element concatenation of
      a and b.  Each value of r contains the result of converting the
      corresponding single-precision element of v to half-precision.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xvcvsphp t,a
 xvcvsphp u,b
 vpkuwum  r,u,t

intrinsics.name: Vector Pack Pixel
intrinsics.purpose:
Packs information from each element of two vectors into the result
      vector.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b.  The
      value of each element of r is taken
      from the corresponding element of v as
      follows:
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Pack Saturated
intrinsics.purpose:
Packs information from each element of two vectors into the result
      vector, using saturated values.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b. The
      value of each element of r is the
      saturated value of the corresponding element of v.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Pack Saturated Unsigned
intrinsics.purpose:
Packs information from each element of two vectors into the result
      vector, using unsigned saturated values.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b. The
      value of each element of r is the
      saturated value of the corresponding element of v.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Parity over Least-Significant Bits of Bytes
intrinsics.purpose: Compute parity on the least-significant bit of each byte.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the parity computed over the
      low-order bit of each of the bytes in the corresponding element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Permute
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector that contains elements selected from two
      vectors, in the order specified by a third vector.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b.  Each
      byte of r selected by using the
      least-significant 5 bits of the corresponding byte of c as an index into v.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Permute and Exclusive-OR
intrinsics.purpose:
Applies a permute and exclusive-OR operation on two vectors of byte
      elements, with the selected elements identified by a third vector.
intrinsics.result:
For each
      i (0 ≤ i < 16), let
      x be bits 0–3 and
      y be bits 4–7 of byte element
      i of c.  Byte
      element i of r
      is set to the exclusive-OR of byte elements x
      of a and y
      of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Polynomial Multiply-Sum Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs the exclusive-OR operation (implementing polynomial addition)
      on each even-odd pair of the polynomial-multiplication result of the
      corresponding elements of a and
      b.
intrinsics.result:
Each element
      i of r is
      computed by an exclusive-OR operation of the polynomial
      multiplication of input elements 2 × i of
      a and b and input elements 2 ×
      i + 1 of a and
      b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Population Count
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the number of bits set in each element of
      the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the number of bits set
      in the corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Reciprocal Estimate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing estimates of the reciprocals of the
      corresponding elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the estimated value of the
      reciprocal of the corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Reciprocal Divide
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing refined approximations of the
      division of the corresponding elements of a by the corresponding elements of
      b.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains a refined approximation of
      the division of the corresponding element of a by the corresponding element of b.

list.implementation:
xvresp      t,b
  xvmulsp     u,a,t
  xvnmsubasp  r/a,b,u
  xvmaddmsp   r/a,t,u

xvredp      t,b
  xvnmsubadp  z,b,t
  xvmaddadp   u,z,t
  xvmuldp     v,a,u
  xvnmsubadp  r/a,b,v
  xvmaddmdp   r/a,u,v

intrinsics.name: Vector Reverse Bytes
intrinsics.purpose: Reverse the bytes of each vector element of a vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the byte-reversed value of
      the corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Reverse Elements
intrinsics.purpose: Reverse the elements of a vector.
intrinsics.result:
Returns a vector
      with the elements of the source vector in reversed order.
intrinsics.endianness:
The vpermr instruction is most naturally used to implement this built-in
      function for a little-endian target, and the vperm instruction for a
      big-endian target.  This is not technically necessary, however, provided
      the correct permute control vector is used.  Note that use of vpermr
      requires ISA 3.0.

intrinsics.name: Vector Round to Nearest Integer
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the floating-point integral values nearest
      to the values of the corresponding elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the nearest representable
      floating-point integral value to the value of the corresponding element
      of a. When an input element value is
      exactly between two integer values, the result value is selected based
      on the rounding mode specified by the Floating-Point Rounding Control
      field (RN) of the FPSCR register.

intrinsics.name: Vector Rotate Left
intrinsics.purpose: Rotates each element of a vector left by a given number of bits.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is obtained by rotating the
      corresponding element of a left by the
      number of bits specified by the corresponding element of
      b.

intrinsics.name: Vector Rotate Left then Mask Insert
intrinsics.purpose:
Rotates each element of a vector left and inserts each element under
      a mask.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is obtained by rotating the
      corresponding element of vector b left
      and inserting it under mask into the corresponding element of
      a. Bits 11:15 of the corresponding
      element of c contain the mask
      beginning, bits 19:23 contain the mask end, and bits 27:31 contain the
      shift count.
intrinsics.endianness: The referenced bit numbers within the elements of c are in left-to-right order.

intrinsics.name: Vector Rotate Left then AND with Mask
intrinsics.purpose:
Rotates each element of a vector left, then logically ANDs it with a
      mask.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      a is rotated left, then logically ANDed
      with a mask specified by b and
      c.

list.implementation:
vspltisw t,8
 vslw     u,b,t
 xxlor    v,u,c
 vrlwnm   r,a,v

xxspltib t,8
 vextsb2d u,t
 vsld     v,b,u
 xxlor    w,v,c
 vrldnm   r,a,w

intrinsics.name: Vector Round
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the rounded values of the corresponding
      elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the value of the
      corresponding element of a, rounded
      to the nearest representable floating-point integer, using IEEE
      round-to-nearest rounding.  The current floating-point rounding
      mode is ignored.

intrinsics.name: Vector Reciprocal Square Root
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing a refined approximation of the reciprocal
      square roots of the corresponding elements of the source vector. This
      function provides an implementation-dependent greater precision than
      vec_rsqrte.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains a refined approximation of
      the reciprocal square root of the corresponding element of
      a.

list.implementation:
xvrsqrtesp  t,a
  xvmulsp     u,t,a
  xvmulsp     v,t,h
  xvnmsubmsp  v,u,h
  xvmaddmsp   r/v,t,t

xvrsqrtedp  t,a
  xvmuldp     u,t,a
  xvmuldp     v,t,h
  xxlor       w,h,h
  xvnmsubadp  w,u,v
  xvmaddadp   v,v,w
  xvmaddadp   u,u,w
  xvnmsubmdp  u,v,h
  xvmaddadp   v,v,u
  xvadddp     r,v,v

intrinsics.name: Vector Reciprocal Square Root Estimate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing estimates of the reciprocal square roots of
      the corresponding elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the estimated value of the
      reciprocal square root of the corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector AES SubBytes Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs the SubBytes operation, as defined in Federal Information
      Processing Standards FIPS-197, on a state_array contained in
      a.
intrinsics.result:
r contains the
      result of the SubBytes operation, as defined in Federal Information
      Processing Standard FIPS-197, on the state array represented by
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Select
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector selecting bits from two source vectors
      depending on the corresponding bit values of a third source
      vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each bit of
      r has the value of the corresponding
      bit of a if the corresponding bit of
      c is 0. Otherwise, the bit of
      r has the value of the corresponding
      bit of b.

intrinsics.name: Vector SHA Sigma Big-Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Performs a Secure Hash computation in accordance with Federal
      Information Processing Standards FIPS-180-3.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the SHA256 or SHA512 hash
      as follows.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Floating-Point to Signed Integer
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts a vector of floating-point numbers to a vector of signed
      integers.
intrinsics.result:
Each
      element of r is obtained by
      truncating the corresponding element of a to a signed integer.  The current
      floating-point rounding mode is ignored.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Signed Word
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts two vectors of double-precision floating-point numbers to a
      vector of signed 32-bit integers.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b.  Each
      element of r is obtained by truncating
      the corresponding element of v to a
      signed 32-bit integer.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxpermdi   t,a,b,0
 xxpermdi   u,a,b,3
 xvcvdpsxws v,t
 xvcvdpsxws w,u
 vmrgew     r,v,w

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Signed Word Even
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts elements of a source vector to signed integers and stores
      them in the even-numbered elements of the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
Element 0 of
      r contains element 0 of a, truncated to a signed integer.  Element 2 of
      r contains element 1 of a, truncated to a signed integer.  Elements 1 and
      3 of r are undefined.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Signed Word Odd
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts elements of a source vector to signed integers and stores them
      in the odd-numbered elements of the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
Element 1 of
      r contains element 0 of a, truncated to a signed integer.  Element 3 of
      r contains element 1 of a, truncated to a signed integer.  Elements 0 and
      2 of r are undefined.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a left shift for each element of a vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is the result of left-shifting the
      corresponding element of a by the
      number of bits specified by the corresponding element of b, modulo the number of bits in the element.
      Zeros are shifted in from the right.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left Double
intrinsics.purpose:
Left shifts a double vector (that is, two concatenated vectors) by a
      given number of bytes. For vec_sld being performed on the vector bool
      and floating-point types, the result is undefined when the specified
      shift count is not a multiple of the element size.
intrinsics.result:
Vector r receives the most-significant 16 bytes obtained
      by concatenating a and b and shifting left by the number of bytes
      specified by c, which must be in the
      range 0–15.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left Double by Words
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector obtained by shifting left the concatenated source
      vectors by the number of specified words.
intrinsics.result:
Vector r receives the most-significant 16 bytes obtained
      by concatenating a and b and shifting left by the number of words
      specified by c, which must be in the
      range 0–3.
intrinsics.endianness:
This intrinsic is not endian-neutral, so uses of
      vec_sldw in big-endian code must be rewritten for little-endian targets.
      The concatenation of a and b is
      done in big-endian fashion (left to right), and the shift is always
      to the left.  This will generally produce surprising results for
      little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left Long
intrinsics.purpose: Left shifts an entire vector by a given number of bits.
intrinsics.result:
Vector
      r contains the contents of a, shifted left by the number of bits specified
      by the three least-significant bits of b. Zeros are supplied on the right. The shift
      count must have been replicated into all bytes of b; if not, the value of r is undefined.
intrinsics.endianness:
This intrinsic is not endian-neutral, so uses of
      vec_sll in big-endian code must be rewritten for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left by Octets
intrinsics.purpose: Left shifts a vector by a given number of bytes (octets).
intrinsics.result:
Vector r receives the contents of a, shifted left by the number of bytes specified
      by bits 1:4 of the least-significant byte of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
This intrinsic is not endian-neutral, so uses of
      vec_slo in big-endian code must be rewritten for little-endian targets.
      The shift count is in element 15 of b
      for big-endian, but in element 0 of b
      for little-endian.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Left Variable
intrinsics.purpose: Left-shifts a vector by a varying number of bits by element.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be a 17-byte vector formed from a in bytes [0:15] and a zero byte in element 16.
      Then each byte element i of r is determined as follows.  The start bit
      sb is obtained from bits 5:7 of byte element
      i of b.  Then
      the contents of bits sb:sb+7
      of the halfword in byte elements
      i:i+1 of v are placed into byte element
      i of r.
intrinsics.endianness:
All bit and byte element numbers are specified in big-endian order.
      This intrinsic is not endian-neutral.

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector that has all of its elements set to a given value.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the value of the
      element of a specified by b, which must be an element number less than the
      number of elements supported for a's
      type.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Signed Byte
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of r is given the
      sign-extended 5-bit value of a.
      The range of this value is [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Signed Halfword
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of r is given the
      sign-extended 5-bit value of a.
      The range of this value is [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Signed Word
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of r is given the
      sign-extended 5-bit value of a.
      The range of this value is [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Unsigned Byte
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
The 5-bit signed value of a is
      sign-extended to a byte and the resulting value is cast to an
      unsigned char.  This value is placed in each element of
      r.  The range of the original value is
      [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Unsigned Halfword
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
The 5-bit signed value of a is
      sign-extended to a halfword and the resulting value is cast to an
      unsigned short.  This value is placed in each element of
      r.  The range of the original value is
      [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat to Unsigned Word
intrinsics.purpose: Returns a vector with all elements equal to the given value.
intrinsics.result:
The 5-bit signed value of a is
      sign-extended to a word and the resulting value is cast to an
      unsigned int.  This value is placed in each element of
      r.  The range of the original value is
      [-16:15].

intrinsics.name: Vector Splat Scalar
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector with the value of each element set to the value of
      the scalar input parameter.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is set to the value of a.

list.implementation:
rlwinm  t,a,0,0xff
  mtvsrd  u,t
  vspltb  r,u,7

rlwinm  t,a,0,0xff
  mtvsrd  u,t
  vspltb  r,u,7

rlwinm  t,a,0,0xffff
  mtvsrd  u,t
  vsplth  r,u,3

rlwinm  t,a,0,0xffff
  mtvsrd  u,t
  vsplth  r,u,3

intrinsics.name: Vector Square Root
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the square root of each element in the
      source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is the square root of the
      corresponding element of a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Right
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a logical right shift for each element of a vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is the result of logically
      right-shifting the corresponding element of a by the number of bits specified by the
      corresponding element of b, modulo the
      number of bits in the element. Zeros are shifted in from the
      left.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Right Algebraic
intrinsics.purpose: Performs an algebraic right shift for each element of a vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is the result of algebraically
      right-shifting the corresponding element of a by the number of bits specified by the
      corresponding element of b, modulo the
      number of bits in the element. Copies of the sign bit are shifted in
      from the left.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Right Long
intrinsics.purpose: Right shifts a vector by a given number of bits.
intrinsics.result:
Vector r contains the contents of a, shifted right by the number of bits specified
      by the 3 least-significant bits of b.
      Zeros are supplied on the left. The shift count must have been
      replicated into all bytes of b; if not,
      the value of r is undefined.
intrinsics.endianness:
This intrinsic is not endian-neutral, so uses of
      vec_srl in big-endian code must be rewritten for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Right by Octets
intrinsics.purpose: Right shifts a vector by a given number of bytes (octets).
intrinsics.result:
Vector
      r receives the contents of
      a, shifted right by the number of bytes
      specified by bits 1–4 of the least-significant byte of
      b.
      Zeros are supplied from the left.

intrinsics.name: Vector Shift Right Variable
intrinsics.purpose: Right-shifts a vector by a varying number of bits by element.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be a 17-byte vector formed from a zero byte
      in element 0 and the elements of a
      in bytes [1:16].  Then each byte element i of
      r is determined as follows.  The
      start bit sb is obtained from bits 5:7 of
      byte element i of b.  Then the contents of bits
      (8 – sb):(15 – sb) of the
      halfword in byte elements i:i+1
      of v are placed into byte element
      i of r.
intrinsics.endianness:
All bit and byte element numbers are specified in big-endian order.
      This intrinsic is not endian-neutral.

intrinsics.name: Vector Store Indexed
intrinsics.purpose:
Stores a 16-byte vector into memory at the address specified by a
      displacement and a pointer, ignoring the four low-order bits
      of the calculated address.
intrinsics.result:
A memory address
      is obtained by adding b and c, and masking off the four low-order bits of the
      result.  The 16-byte vector in a is
      stored to the resultant memory address.

intrinsics.name: Vector Store Element Indexed
intrinsics.purpose:
Stores a single element from a 16-byte vector into memory at the address
      specified by a displacement and a pointer, aligned to the element size.
intrinsics.result:
The integer value
      b is added to the pointer value
      c.  The resulting address is rounded
      down to the nearest address that is a multiple of
      es, where es is 1 for char
      pointers, 2 for short pointers, and 4 for float or int pointers.
      An element offset eo is calculated by taking the
      resultant address modulo 16.  The vector element of a at offset eo is stored
      to the resultant address.

intrinsics.name: Vector Store Indexed Least Recently Used
intrinsics.purpose:
Stores a 16-byte vector into memory at the address specified by a
      displacement and a pointer, ignoring the four low-order bits
      of the calculated address, and marking the cache line containing
      the address as least frequently used.
intrinsics.result:
A memory address
      is obtained by adding b and c, and masking off the four low-order bits of the
      result.  The 16-byte vector in a is
      stored to the resultant memory address, and the containing cache
      line is marked as least frequently used.

intrinsics.name: Vector Subtract
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the result of subtracting each element of
      one source vector from the corresponding element of another source
      vector.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the result of
      subtracting the value of the corresponding element of b from the value of the corresponding element of
      a. The arithmetic is modular for
      integer vectors.

intrinsics.name: Vector Subtract Carryout
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector wherein each element contains the carry
      produced by subtracting the corresponding elements of the two
      source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the complement of the
      carry produced by subtracting the value of the corresponding element of
      b from the value of the corresponding
      element of a. The value is 0 if a
      borrow occurred, or 1 if no borrow occurred.

intrinsics.name: Vector Subtract Extended
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the result of first elementwise subtracting
      one vector from another vector, and then elementwise adding a third
      carry vector. Elements of the carry vector have a value of 0 or 1.
intrinsics.result:
Let c' be a vector for which each element is 0 if
      the rightmost bit of the corresponding element of c is 0, and 1 otherwise. Then the value of each
      element of r is produced by subtracting
      the corresponding element of b from the
      corresponding element of a, and then
      adding the corresponding element of c'.

list.implementation:
vspltisw  t,1
  vsubuwm   u,a,b
  xxland    v,c,t
  vsubuwm   r,u,v

vspltisw  t,1
  vsubuwm   u,a,b
  xxland    v,c,t
  vsubuwm   r,u,v

intrinsics.name: Vector Subtract Extended Carryout
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the carries produced by subtracting one
      vector from another, then adding a third vector to the difference.  The
      third vector is a carry vector, with each element having a value of 0
      or 1.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the carry produced by
      subtracting the corresponding element of b from the corresponding element of a, and then adding the carry specified in the
      corresponding element of c (1 if there
      is a carry, 0 otherwise).

list.implementation:
vspltisw  t,1
  xxland    u,c,t
  vsubuwm   v,a,b
  vsubcuw   w,a,b
  vsubcuw   x,v,u
  xxlor     r,w,x

vspltisw  t,1
  xxland    u,c,t
  vsubuwm   v,a,b
  vsubcuw   w,a,b
  vsubcuw   x,v,u
  xxlor     r,w,x

intrinsics.name: Vector Subtract Saturated
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the saturated differences of each set of
      corresponding elements of the source vectors.
intrinsics.result:
The value of each
      element of r is the saturated result of
      subtracting the value of the corresponding element of b from the value of the corresponding element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Sum Across Half
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a sum-across
      operation within each doubleword of the first source vector together with
      accumulated results in the second source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0 and 2
      of r are 0. Element 1 of r contains the saturated sum of elements 0 and 1
      of a and element 1 of b. Element 3 of r contains the saturated sum of elements 2 and 3
      of a and element 3 of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Sum Across Quarter
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a sum-across
      operation within each word of the first source vector together with
      accumulated results in the second source vector.

intrinsics.name: Vector Sum Across
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the results of performing a sum-across
      operation on the first source vector together with accumulated results
      in the second source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Elements 0, 1, and 2
      of r are 0. Element 3 is the saturated
      sum of all the elements of a and
      element 3 of b.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Test Data Class
intrinsics.purpose: Determines the data class for each floating-point element.

intrinsics.name: Vector Truncate
intrinsics.purpose:
Returns a vector containing the truncated values of the corresponding
      elements of the source vector.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r contains the value of the
      corresponding element of a, truncated
      to an integral value.

intrinsics.name: Vector Unpack High
intrinsics.purpose:
Unpacks the most-significant (“high”) half of a vector into a vector
      with larger elements.
intrinsics.result:
If a is an integer vector, the value of each element
      of r is the value of the corresponding
      element of the most-significant half of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
The "high" half of a vector with n elements is the
      first n/2 elements of the vector.  For little
      endian, these elements are in the rightmost half of the vector.  For
      big endian, these elements are in the leftmost half of the vector.

list.implementation:
xxsldwi   t,a,a,1
 xxsldwi   u,t,a,3
 xvcvspdp  r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Unpack Low
intrinsics.purpose:
Unpacks the least-significant (“low”) half of a vector into a vector
      with larger elements.
intrinsics.result:
If a is an integer vector, the value of each element
      of r is the value of the corresponding
      element of the least-significant half of a.
intrinsics.endianness:
The "high" half of a vector with n elements is the
      first n/2 elements of the vector.  For little
      endian, these elements are in the rightmost half of the vector.  For
      big endian, these elements are in the leftmost half of the vector.

list.implementation:
xxsldwi   t,a,a,3
 xxsldwi   u,a,t,2
 xvcvspdp  r,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Floating-Point to Unsigned Integer
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts a vector of floating-point numbers to a vector of unsigned
      integers.
intrinsics.result:
Each element of
      r is obtained by truncating the
      corresponding element of a to an
      unsigned integer.  The current floating-point rounding mode is
      ignored.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Unsigned Word
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts two vectors of double-precision floating-point numbers to a
      vector of unsigned 32-bit integers.
intrinsics.result:
Let v be the concatenation of a and b.  Each
      element of r is obtained by truncating
      the corresponding element of v to an
      unsigned 32-bit integer.  The current floating-point rounding
      mode is ignored.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

list.implementation:
xxpermdi   t,a,b,3
 xxpermdi   u,a,b,0
 xvcvdpuxws v,t
 xvcvdpuxws w,u
 vmrgew     r,v,w

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Unsigned Word Even
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts elements of the source vector to unsigned integers and stores
      them in the even-numbered elements of the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
Element 0 of
      r contains element 0 of a, truncated to an unsigned integer.  Element 2 of
      r contains element 1 of a, truncated to a signed integer.  Elements 1 and
      3 of r are undefined.  Truncation
      of a negative number to an unsigned integer results in a value of
      zero.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: Vector Convert Double-Precision to Unsigned Word Odd
intrinsics.purpose:
Converts elements of the source vector to unsigned integers and stores
      them in the odd-numbered elements of the result vector.
intrinsics.result:
Element 1 of
      r contains element 0 of a, truncated to an unsigned integer.  Element 3 of
      r contains element 1 of a, truncated to an unsigned integer.  Elements 0
      and 2 of r are undefined.  Truncation
      of a negative number to an unsigned integer results in a value of
      zero.
intrinsics.endianness:
The element numbering within a register is left-to-right for big-endian
      targets, and right-to-left for little-endian targets.

intrinsics.name: VSX Unaligned Load
intrinsics.purpose:
Loads a 16-byte vector from the memory address specified by the
      displacement and the pointer.
intrinsics.result:
The value of
      r is obtained by adding a and b, then
      loading the 16-byte vector from the resultant memory address.
intrinsics.endianness:
For ISA 2.07, there is no bi-endian unaligned load instruction.
      For little-endian targets, it is necessary to use the lxvd2x instruction
      and swap the doublewords with an xxswapd instruction.  For big-endian
      targets, the lxvd2x instruction or lxvw4x instruction suffices.  The
      examples below assume ISA 3.0, where the bi-endian lxv instruction is
      available.

intrinsics.name: VSX Unaligned Load as Big Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Loads a vector from an address into a register in big-endian element
      order, regardless of the endianness of the target machine.
intrinsics.result:
The value of
      r is obtained by adding a and b, then
      loading the vector elements from the resulting address in big-endian
      order.
intrinsics.endianness:
In big-endian mode, this acts just like the vec_xl intrinsic.
      In little-endian mode, the highest-numbered element of r is loaded from the lowest data address, and
      the lowest-numbered element of r from
      the highest data address.

intrinsics.name: Vector Load with Length
intrinsics.purpose: Loads a vector of a specified byte length.
intrinsics.result:
Loads the number of
      bytes specified by b from the address
      specified in a. Initializes elements in
      order from the byte stream (as defined by the endianness of the target).
      Any bytes of elements that cannot be initialized from the
      number of loaded bytes have a zero value.

intrinsics.name: Vector Load with Length Right-Justified
intrinsics.purpose: Loads a vector of a specified byte length, right-justified.
intrinsics.result:
Loads the number of
      bytes specified by b from the address
      specified in a, right justified in
      r. Initializes elements in order from
      the byte stream (as defined by the endianness of the target).
      Any bytes of elements that cannot be initialized from the
      number of loaded bytes have a zero value.

list.implementation:
sldi  t,b,56
  lvsl  u,0,b
  lxvll v,a,t
  vperm r,v,v,u

intrinsics.name: Vector Exclusive OR
intrinsics.purpose: Performs a bitwise XOR of two vectors.
intrinsics.result:
v is the bitwise
      exclusive OR of a and b.

intrinsics.name: VSX Unaligned Store
intrinsics.purpose:
Stores a 16-byte value into memory at the address specified by the
      displacement and pointer.
intrinsics.result:
The values of
      b and c are added, and the value of a is stored to the resultant address.
intrinsics.endianness:
For ISA 2.07, there is no bi-endian unaligned store instruction.  For
      little-endian targets, it is necessary to first swap the doublewords
      of the value to be stored using an xxswapd instruction, and then store
      the result using the stxvd2x instruction.  For big-endian targets, the
      stxvd2x or stxvw4x instruction suffices.  The examples below assume ISA
      3.0, where the bi-endian stxv instruction is available.

intrinsics.name: VSX Unaligned Store as Big Endian
intrinsics.purpose:
Stores a vector to an address using big-endian
      element order, regardless of the endianness of the target machine.
intrinsics.result:
The values of
      b and c are added, and the value of a is stored to the resultant address using
      big-endian element order.
intrinsics.endianness:
In big-endian mode, this acts just like the vec_xst intrinsic.  In
      little-endian mode, the lowest data address receives the
      highest-numbered element of a, and
      the highest data address receives the lowest-numbered element of
      a.

intrinsics.name: Vector Store with Length
intrinsics.purpose: Stores a vector of a specified byte length.
intrinsics.result:
Stores the number of
      bytes specified by c of the vector
      a to the address specified in
      b. The bytes are obtained starting from
      the lowest-numbered byte of the lowest-numbered element (as defined by
      the endianness of the target). All bytes of an element
      are accessed before proceeding to the next higher element.

intrinsics.name: Vector Store with Length Right-Justified
intrinsics.purpose: Stores a right-justified vector of a specified byte length.
intrinsics.result:
Stores the number of
      bytes specified by c of the
      right-justified vector a to the address
      specified by b.

list.implementation:
lvsr   t,0,c
  sldi   u,c,56
  vperm  v,a,a,t
  stxvll v,b,u
